text:
appreciating <@UAUCGGD6C>  for `argmax(f, xs)`  after at least 18 months of debate
<https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/27613>
The changes where you have to go through that are the hardest
so I really appreciate when people pull it off.

text: Yes, that’s wonderful to have; what a surprising schlep that was. Also very grateful for the perseverance

text:
I have definitely written
```last(maximum((f(x), x) for x in xs))```
more than once
because we didn’t have this

elements.text: last(maximum((f(x), x) for x in xs))

text: :+1: I've wanted this for a long time, and it's a good case study in how seemingly-simple things can require very careful design and thinking.

elements.text: I've wanted this for a long time, and it's a good case study in how seemingly-simple things can require very careful design and thinking.

text: On that note, do you have anything that you wish you had designed differently if we had better compiler tech at the time?
